oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Note signed by General Leonidas Polk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A note written in blue by General Leonidas Polk telling James P. Wood to not let the cotton through the railways without his permission so that it would not fall in the hands of the Federal Army. Wood was in charge of the Memphis and Ohio Railroad and Memphis and Charleston Railroad.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Metro Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
